p: Salmonella is a rod-shaped Gram-negative bacterium belonging to the family Enterobacteriaceae and is the causative agent of salmonellosis, which is characterized by two major syndromes: systemic septicemia and enteritis. Also, it can cause diarrhea, abortion, arthritis, respiratory diseases, necrosis of extremities, and meningitis. S. typhi and S. paratyphi produce typhoid in people, S. gallinarum in poultry, S. abortusovis in sheep, S. choleraesuis in pigs, S. dublin in cattle, etc. [ 16â€“ 18].
